text: Alan Leslie "Fluff" Freeman (born 6 July 1927 in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, died 27 November 2006 in London, England) was an Australian radio presenter who worked for most of his career in the United Kingdom. In May 2000 he was presented with a Lifetime Achievement award at the Sony Radio Academy Awards.BBC News | ENTERTAINMENT | Not arf! Awards glory for Fluff Freeman was best known for presenting Pick of the Pops on BBC Radio 1 throughout the 1960s and 1970s.
